attributes.action: Urge the government to extend Help to Buy to include old properties.
attributes.background: The Government has dragged it's heels dealing with the housing crisis in London so as a result we need to urge them to do more regarding affordable housing. One of the things the government can and should do is extend the Help to Buy scheme to include older properties.
attributes.additional_details: The help to buy scheme could be really useful if it were extended to include older properties. The government should also charge a percentage identical to the bank of England base rate after the 5yr free period. If the UK government is serious about helping Londoners get on the ladder they should revise the Help to Buy scheme immediately to include older properties as house builders have pushed up the cost of new builds at an alarming rate. Not everyone wants a new build.

attributes.action: Increase the funding of the cadet forces of Britain
attributes.background: The cadets are poorly funded and that's not good so more money would be nice so we can all get susats and jetboils

attributes.action: I want you to to make it law that all Cats & Kittens to be microchipped.
attributes.background: With so many Cats being killed in road traffic accidents, then being discarded by most councils as waste. Many people want to know what has happened to their pet, whether killed in a road accident or lost.

attributes.action: Allow Ugandan LGBT refugees in Kenya to claim UK asylum via the UNHCR.
attributes.background: The UK only allows asylum claims from people who are on its sovereign territory. Hence English speaking Ugandan LGBT refugees in Kenya cannot apply for asylum in the UK. Canda and the USA allow such people to apply for resettlement via the UNHCR while still in Kenya. The UK should do the same.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_Uganda

http://www.washingtonblade.com/2016/04/22/report-anti-lgbt-persecution-increased-under-uganda-law/

http://www.huffingtonpost.com/the-groundtruth-project/inside-the-nightmares-of_b_7674502.html

http://rainbowrailroad.ca/whatwedo

http://www.hias.org/work/resettling-refugees

http://hamiam.de/en/

attributes.action: Withhold aid from countries, such as Uganda, where homosexuality is a crime.
attributes.background: In many countries LGBT people suffer persecution simply for being what they are. They are disowned by their families and suffer death threats from relatives. They have no protection in law, instead police harass them and arrest them. They are in continual danger of prosecution and imprisonment.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_Pakistan

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_Nigeria

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_Uganda

attributes.action: Allow GCSE Science Students Data Sheets with Ions, Equations & Reactivity Series
attributes.background: The outgoing GCSE Science Specifications include a 'Data Sheet' which consists of very important information for candidates, such as ions. It would be a disadvantage for Reformed GCSE students to not be given said information; especially considering that the new qualifications are more challenging.
attributes.additional_details: In GCSE Chemistry, a sheet with ionic formulae and the Reactivity Series of Some Common Metals is given. In GCSE Physics, a sheet consisting of all mathematical equations is also given. It would be a gross disadvantage for Reformed GCSE students to not be given said information; especially considering that the reformed qualifications are more challenging for individuals taking the examinations in Year 11 and without such sheets, comparison between Legacy and Incumbent qualifications is difficult.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to allow children under the age of 16 to have their body pierced
attributes.background:
I was watching a child cry out of fear and pain in a store which allows children to get there ears pierced. Yes the parents gave consent to it, but the child defiantly didn't know what was going on, watching this really upset me.

I think the law needs to be stricter on piercings in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: Despite many piercing salons imposing their own age restrictions for body piercings, there is no legal age restriction for any kind of piercing in England and Wales, unlike in Scotland, where people under 16 are required to have a parent’s permission before having ears and other body parts pierced.

attributes.action: Government to introduce clause to declassify first class on trains at peak times
attributes.background: During peak / commuter hours, many trains are running at capacity except for the first class areas, which are often empty. This is forcing people to stand when they could be sitting in comfort and therefore having a more enjoyable commute to work.
attributes.additional_details: As the government is responsible for issuing the franchises to companies to run trains on the railways, I am calling for a clause to be added at the time of renewals for first class to be de classified during peak hours or on commuter trains. Unlike the intercity trains, there are no real benefits from having first class (i.e no refreshment service) and the seats are often no different. These seats could be used by more people and offer value for money when prices are  increasing annually.

attributes.action: Allow the Church of England to legally perform gay marriages
attributes.background: The Government's Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Bill was on 17th July 2013. However, The Act does not allow the Church of England to perform same sex marriages. If the church is willing to perform them or not should not matter, the law should not prevent the church from doing them.
attributes.additional_details:
The legislation to create same - sex marriage was explicitly drafted so that no church or church minister can be compelled " by any means " to carry out same - sex wedding. The Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Act contains the Government's ' quad lock ', a set of four safeguards for churches and ministers who disagree with same sex marriage. The fourth safeguard states that the Church of England cannot opt in under the terms of the 
2013 Act.

attributes.action: Delay Article 50 until the policy of the US towards Russia and NATO is clearer
attributes.background: A strong European Union is essential if stronger ties between the US and Russia are formed and US support for NATO is reduced. Triggering Article 50 before US policy becomes clear could be highly detrimental to the stability of all European countries including the UK.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2017/feb/09/brexit-trump-britain-national-security-article-50

attributes.action: Retiring UK Soldiers should be fast tracked/prioritised jobs within the police.
attributes.background: Our retiring Soldiers have protected us and our country for hundreds of years with little or no return when they come back to civilian life. They need structure and purpose while they become readjusted to working and living away from the Forces. Intelligence/strength/pride Would win the war on crime
attributes.additional_details: Our police force has become disrespected by the communities they serve. This is in part of lowering standards of our once great police force. The passing fitness test is a joke, once passed They have just 30 minutes a week to spend on fitness so there is no surprise their not up to the high standards they should be! So fast track retiring military into the police, people who are fit, strong, intelligent, think on their feet and who have worked in dangerous environments all their lives.

attributes.action: Funds to support community fridge's around the U.K.
attributes.background:
To have community fridges available to help homeless and people on low income or unemployed. 

Allow businesses and public to donate unwanted food into community fridges to help people who can't afford or struggling to feed family.

attributes.action: Get a ban for killing animals for people to eat.
attributes.background: While watching 'Babe' my 6 year old Myla burst into tears while the pigs were being taken to the slaughterhouse and said "this has to stop, mum start a petition to get it stopped". So here we are giving it my best go. Please make a massive change in this world and a little girl happy by signing.

attributes.action: Charge for GP apptments. Allow GP's to dispense low cost drugs such as aspirin.
attributes.background:
A small charge for visit to GP would deter time wasters & release funds for deserving needs. 
GP's prescribe aspirin and similar drugs costing a few pence which incur standard £10-£12 "Pharmacy handling" charge to the Dept of Health. Curb this waste too and spend on more deserving needs
attributes.additional_details:
From data in the public domain it is evident that many patients fail to attend appointments with virtually no financial penalty. A £5-£10 per person per appointment (with some exceptions) is affordable by the majority of inhabitants.
Prescriptions for low cost (normally over the counter) drugs incur significant "handling" charge. By permitting/instructing GP's to dispense such items the savings can be diverted/used to benefit more urgent demands on the Health Service.

attributes.action: Prevent Xi Jinping from making any State Visits to the United Kingdom
attributes.background: Xi Jinping should not be allowed to enter the UK in his capacity as head of the Chinese government due to the Chinese communist parties prolific violation of human rights.
attributes.additional_details: Since Xi Jinping became President of the People's Republic of China (PRC) in March 2013, the human rights group CHRD has documented more than 1,800 cases of arbitrary detention and torture of human rights activists and lawyers.

attributes.action: Impose sanctions on Trump and his cabinet if they withdraw from or ignore COP21.
attributes.background: Individuals in the current US administration have in the past shown disregard for scientific data on climate change and are signaling they might not follow on US commitments taken at the COP21 agreement. The UK should consider putting such individuals on the list of financial sanctions target.

attributes.action: PSHE in all schools includes topics about domestic violence, LGBTQ+ and consent.
attributes.background: As pupils, we feel it necessary to have issues on domestic violence, LGBTQ+ rights and consent included in the curriculum of all senior PSHE lessons. We believe that this is crucial as all young adults should be well educated about these topics and should be able to access support and true facts.
attributes.additional_details: The Government has already talked about this issue, yet they briefly touched on it and didn't look leave enough time to fully discuss and vote on this important issue.

attributes.action: Publish a White Paper on the Brexit plan before Parliament's vote on Article 50
attributes.background: The Government should be transparent and accountable to Parliament with regards to its plans for negotiations to exit the EU. A White Paper setting out its plans should be published to enable proper debate in Parliament before the vote on triggering Article 50.

attributes.action: Create a constituency with a dedicated MP representing British overseas citizens
attributes.background: Over 5 million citizens live outside of the UK, a large number of which cannot vote as they have been resident abroad for 15 years or more. Moreover, British citizens are not represented in Parliament. Democratically, over 5 million citizens abroad should be represented by at least one MP.
attributes.additional_details:
Other countries have created constituencies outside of their national borders, with representation in Parliament through one or more dedicated MPs. 
With over 5 million British citizens abroad, of whom a majority is not allowed to vote due to the 15 years residency restriction, it would be democratic to at least ensure that this significant proportion of British citizens is duly represented in Parliament.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for street lights to utilize motion sensors to turn them on.
attributes.background: I believe that there is no need for street lights to be turned on when they are not in use. This is a waste of energy. My solution for this is to make it mandatory for street lights to incorporate motion sensors to activate them, therefore will only be turned on when they will be utilized.

attributes.action: Increase government funding for child abuse organisations and therapy services.
attributes.background:
Thousands of children everyday are being abused, in the UK.  
How can we as citizens do nothing to help the vulnerable children being tormented?  How can we let the dreams of the youth be destroyed?
 They will be OUR FUTURE! YOU can make a difference by signing this petition.
attributes.additional_details:
-There are currently over 57,000 children identified as needing protection from abuse in the UK
-For every child identified as needing protection from abuse, another 8 are suffering abuse. 
https://www.nspcc.org.uk/services-and-resources/research-and-resources/statistics/

Remember YOU can help change their lives. So, support this cause.

attributes.action: Penalties for those who park in parent-toddler spaces without children
attributes.background: As a father of two children and a driver, I find it hugely ignorant of those who find it acceptable to park in parent-toddler spaces when they do not have children. There are penalities for parking in a disabled space incorrectly so why not the same for parent-toddler spaces?

attributes.action: I want to lower the abortion limit
attributes.background: A baby is a baby from conception but more so knowing it's got a heartbeat at 6-7 weeks. 24 weeks a baby is developed it can survive. I don't agree that a baby can be born before 24 weeks and they won't save it but as soon as it's over 24 weeks they will fight to save the baby.
attributes.additional_details: The abortion limit needs to be lowered to below 12 weeks!!

attributes.action: Speed up DBS checks
attributes.background: Care companies are in crisis due to the waiting time for DBS checks. Staff only have to give a months notice to leave  but to get new staff to cover them can take months, It is hard enough getting staff to work in the care industry and many give up the wait after 4 weeks as need to be in paid work.

attributes.action: To make a ban on eating disorder websites or videos as this destroys lives.
attributes.background: This is something that effects me. I think that promoting the way doing eating disorders is disgusting and should be a crime as it affects lives. I have seen all these websites where they tell best was to purge (throwing up food). This is horrible and needs to stop as this is killing people.
attributes.additional_details: The are many horrible web sites like these that need to be banned as they are destroying lives and families. Please help me stop these horrible websites as they are messing peoples lives.

attributes.action: Assure that the Banbury Horton General Hospital stays open as Oxford is too far!
attributes.background: In writing this as a ambulance practitioner I am solely concerned with patients care as for a seriously ill patient or one in cardiac arrest yo be conveyed from Banbury and surrounding area all the way to Oxford would assuredly kill them we must protect Horton Hospital as a local Banbury resource!!!
attributes.additional_details: See NHS statistics and the resuscitation councils standards for early access in cardiac arrest and cardiac event cases and or cva's/stroke victims time every single second counts

attributes.action: A standard internet speed of 24 megabits per second (Mbps) for the UK.
attributes.background: In the 21st Century our lives are dependent on the internet; while in Dorset, Eng we have to depend on 0.64 Mbps download. This is humiliatingly far behind other nations' and insufficient to even stream a film. Therefore, we propose a minimum speed of 24 Mbps that will ensure fair speeds for the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are some examples of the poor speeds from across the UK:

http://www.bbc.co.uk/newsbeat/article/38067272/autumn-statement-five-places-you-say-need-better-broadband-around-the-uk

In rural Dorset: http://www.speedtest.net/my-result/5904028990

http://www.techdigest.tv/2016/12/4g-coverage-better-in-peru-than-britain-says-damning-report-from-lord-adonis.html

http://www.telecomstechnews.com/news/2016/dec/20/uk-14-million-premises-lack-decent-broadband-connections-finds-ofcom/

attributes.action: Introduce a phased ban on multiple point fishing hooks for all leisure angling
attributes.background: For future generations, the welfare and conservation of all native fish species will benefit from a phased UK ban on multiple point hooks for all leisure (sea, coarse and game) angling. This petition proposes to change government policy, restricting anglers to using one single fishing hook per rod.
attributes.additional_details: Leisure angling is one of our biggest recreational pastimes. Whether as a requirement or personal preference, fish should be returned to the water quickly and unharmed. Whilst conservation measures, including a ban on lead weights, help to protect native fish and other wildlife, leisure angling’s use of multiple point hooks remains its Achilles heel. Removal is more time consuming, increases fish stress and the likelihood of harm or death. There are no grounds for defending multiple point hooks.

attributes.action: Compulsory for all non UK residents/visitors to have Gov't run comp medical ins
attributes.background: I've just read about the NHS being £30m in debt to medical tourism and this is isn't the first time I've read about the strain on the NHS from non residents coming here for the maternity/cancer/medical care.Gov needs to operate a scheme for all visitors to have comp care cover before admittance
attributes.additional_details: Please see 120 individual NHS Trust accounts for the amount owed individually for medical tourism.

attributes.action: Stop Corporation tax cuts and put the Money into Social Care.
attributes.background: £4.6 BILLION in corporation tax cuts is currently being planned by the Tory Party.   Yesterday, Wednesday 14th Dec, in the last Prime ministers question time of the year,  Jeremy Corbyn MP appealed for the £4.6b in corporation tax cuts be put into Social care instead to help solve this crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
The Tory government has cut Social Care and the PM, cabinet, and everybody else knows the effects of these cuts.This crisis is a difficult one for many elderly people because it is also a crisis for the NHS. Those people who are in hospital cannot be discharged because there is nowhere else for them to go. The crisis affects individuals, families and The NHS. 

References
https://youtu.be/p_gl4Z-PJTk

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/m.huffpost.com/uk/entry/uk_585149c8e4b08b39538f4bf0/amp

https://www.politicshome.com/news/uk/politics/news/81735/live-prime-ministers-questions-141216

attributes.action: Make driving 25mph or more UNDER the speed limit a punishable offence.
attributes.background: When driving on dual carriage ways or 50mph A roads getting stuck behind drivers who are driving at a speed significantly slower than the speed limit set is a common occurence. It causes unnecessary over taking and can potentially be as dangerous as someone speeding. It needs to be addressed.

attributes.action: Stop Network Rail removing lineside trees for their own commercial gain.
attributes.background: Recently a residential area within Stirling received generic letters for Network Rail advising that from 26th November 2016 they were going to be removing trees and plants from their lineside. They advised this was to minimise the risk of disrupting railway operations.
attributes.additional_details: This proposed action is completely unjustified and un-proportionate. They have not considered the impact on the environment, wildlife and the effect it will have for local residents. The letter states that they will be removing trees,plants and vegetation unto 10 meters from their lineside, this will in effect create a concrete jungle and damage the beautiful aesthetics of Stirling. This must be opposed and stopped as the impact of this is far greater than the commercial gain of a company.

attributes.action: Provide New Zealand with aid to help them rebuild after the earthquake.
attributes.background: In light of the two earthquakes that have just hit the New Zealand south island on 13th Nov, the British Government should provide aid to assist the government and people of New Zealand to rebuild their infrastructure. The money should come from the overseas aid budget

attributes.action: Bring 'Hands-on' STEM Back to Schools
attributes.background: As a STEM Educator and STEM Charity Owner, a important issue has come to light, that a lot of 'Hands-on' STEM skills have been stripped from young people's STEM education, leading to a large skill short-fall when student's carry on studying STEM subjects at university.
attributes.additional_details: Information about this subject has been collected and analysed by volunteers at GlamSci (www.GlamSci.org) whom are a non-profit STEM educational charity concerned with young people's education and rights to STEM subjects. This view is backed by current educational figures gathered by STEM governing bodies, universities and other educational organisations.

attributes.action: Create an age and licence type restriction for drivers of more powerful cars
attributes.background: Young bikers are restricted as to how powerful a bike they can ride based on their age & licence type, yet car drivers can drive any car at any age once they've passed a manual test. This leaves fast cars in the hands of people who aren't competent to drive them, and is also unfair to bikers.
attributes.additional_details: Government statistics from 2011 show that 22% of road fatalities in that year involved drivers aged 17-24. A motorcycle-style age and licence grading system needs to be enforced to reduce these figures.

attributes.action: Prevent companies from defaulting the 'save payment information' on a website
attributes.background: Typically when purchasing online goods, companies by default check the 'Save these payment details'. Saving payment details online isn't a good thing and whilst the option should be there, it shouldn't be defaulted. This should be addressed and could potentially save people from fraudulent purchases
attributes.additional_details: Recently I was the victim of fraud as I may have mistakenly saved my payment card details on a website that was later compromised.

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to close St Bart's Hospital, Rochester, Kent.
attributes.background: There is a lack of provisions in the Medway Towns as it is and we need this hospital. It was used as a rehab hospital for stroke patients and anyone else who needed a longer stay in the hospital. Medway Maritime Hospital will only allow people to stay short term as they need the beds.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is a brief history of the hospital; this is one of the oldest hospitals in Britain, having been founded in 1078 by Gundulph, Bishop of Rochester, for the "poor and leprous". The current hospital building in New Road, Rochester was built in 1861.  The hospital relied on charity donations until 1948 when it was funded by the NHS.

We don't want this historic building to end up in the wrong hands because they may demolish this gothic style building and a piece of Medway history will be gone!

attributes.action: Make it Law for drivers involved in a accident to report to police at the scene
attributes.background: Drivers are able to leave the scene of an accident and be within the law to report it within 24 hours, therefore police are unable to take correct alcohol and drug samples, giving a possible lighter sentence.
attributes.additional_details: Ben regan was killed by a driver who failed to stop and drove home and hid the car, and called the police 10 hours after, to plead not guilty to a careless driving charge due to lack of evidence. Family's are being put through hell because of this loophole. It must be stopped.

attributes.action: Ensure that in future 65% of eligible voters are required to pass a referendum.
attributes.background: For changes that would have a profound effect on the nation its constitution and its people a clear 65% of eligible voters should be the mark so there can be no doubt as to the legitimacy of the vote. In addition Parliament should be legally obliged to honour any passed referendum.
attributes.additional_details: Previous referendums are held at the first past 50% of those that voted is all that is needed to carry a referendum this could be seen as undemocratic as it is not based on the eligible voting public. Also allowing such tight voting margins can be seen to be a cause of civil unrest.

attributes.action: Make it an arrest-able offence for protesters to obstruct roads of any kind
attributes.background: As people are aware protesters come in all different forms and from different beliefs. For those who chose to protest in roads whether it be a side road, entrance to a work sight, or a main road. This is petition is to help make it an arrest-able offence to block roads of any kind.
attributes.additional_details:
Helping stop protesters obstructing roads and access of the road; by making it an arrest-able offence to cause obstruction or disruption too any road of any kind.
This could help prevent companies suing or losing business and increase awareness for road safety and the dangers of protesters using main roads or side roads of any kind.

attributes.action: 1p and 2p coins should be removed from circulation (cash transactions only)
attributes.background:
We the undersigned want to see the 1p and 2p pieces removed from circulation, since they are no longer of a useful value.

Over time, due to inflation, the value of a coin decreases. The one and two penny pieces are now worth so little that we cannot buy anything useful with them.
attributes.additional_details:
It is important to clarify that this petition is not asking for ALL transactions to be rounded to the nearest 5p. This petition only applies to cash. It calls for removal of 1p and 2p coins, therefore any cash transaction would result in change given rounded to the nearest 5p.

Examples
- If I were to use cash to buy a bottle of milk costing 99p, I would receive no change, since 1p rounds down to zero.

- If I were to buy a cake costing 96p, I would receive 5p change, because 4p rounds up to 5p.

attributes.action: Eliminate residency requirements when determining a British Citizens fee status
attributes.background: As a British citizen, one can expect fair and just treatment in their country; one should not be treated any differently than fellow Britons. Currently, a citizen must live in the UK for the 3 year before starting a university course, which discriminates against citizens who live abroad.
attributes.additional_details: With the current fee status terms, many British citizens are classified as international students when returning to their home. Not only are international fees extortionate, this means that a citizen is treated no differently than a foreigner when they are in their own country. These fees may even impede a citizen from returning home. In order to end this discrimination, fee status should be based upon citizenship; a Briton should be considered a Briton, regardless of where s/he has lived.

attributes.action: To create separate employment laws for big businesses & micro/small businesses.
attributes.background: Corporate law does not recognise that small business cannot afford to offer the same 'rights' as big business, such as lengthy paid maternity/paternity leave etc. However, it can offer a more rewarding work environment, where every employee is an individual who is vitally important to the business.
attributes.additional_details: Because every person counts in a small business, it cannot afford to lose an employee for extended periods and pay cover. But by choosing to work in a micro/small business, employees could opt for shorter paid maternity/paternity leave, fewer paid sick days etc. in exchange for other benefits such as greater flexibility in working time & time off. Plus an environment where each employee is vitally important to the success of the business and there is greater equality between the boss and staff.

attributes.action: Allow the continued use of A2 motorcycle restrictor kits.
attributes.background: The plan to prohibit current use of A2 restrictor kit seems unfair to a lot of riders as this is a step up for their current A1 licence restricting the to 125cc motorcycles. The UK is one of the strictest if not the strictest when it comes to motorcycle laws,this is a step in the wrong direction.

attributes.action: Halt the Department of Education's Autumn Census & destroy all data collected.
attributes.background: The Department of Education's Autumn Census expects parents to disclose their children Country of Birth and state 'National Identity' from a list of Welsh, English, Scottish, Irish, British, Other, or Refuse. Parents should not be asked to determine and disclose the national identity of children.

attributes.action: Let voters (Eng, Wal, NI) decide if they want Scotland to remain in Britain.
attributes.background: The Scottish had their say on whether they wanted to remain in Britain or not, but the rest of Britain didn't. No one has taken into consideration what the rest of Britain would like to see and it would only be fair for everyone to have an equal say in the out come from both sides. Let us vote!

attributes.action: Raise the UK speed limit on Motorways and major a roads to 85
attributes.background: Will help with the flow of traffic on major A roads and motorways
attributes.additional_details: Most people already speed on motorways and major A roads and everybody know so  it so instead make it legal instead of illegal.

attributes.action: Make child benefit rules fairer
attributes.background: Currently couples with one partner earning over 60 thousand pounds annually are not entitled to any child benefit. If however both parents are working and they earn over 60 thousand pounds combined but with both individully earning less than that amount, they are entitled to this benefit.
attributes.additional_details: A couple may earn 55 thousand pounds each and get child benefit however if one person earns 60 thousand they do not.

attributes.action: Invest in Tidal Lagoon Power instead of Nuclear - they are green & reliable!
attributes.background: Tidal power is totally reliable and always available. It does not rely on ANY fuel, the wind, or the sun. There is NO waste, it is totally green and works 24/7/365. The tide timing is different in different places, so there are no big gaps. If designed properly, they could be virtually invisible.
attributes.additional_details: Britain has a big coastline, and the proposed tidal lagoon in Wales could be the ideal starting point and testing ground, though I personally think the artist's impression is awful and I think the whole thing should be hidden away out of sight, which it could be if designed properly, a bit like the Cruachan hydroelectric generating station in the mountains in Scotland.

attributes.action: Request a referendum on the £3.9bn refurbishment of the Palace of Westminster
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, request that the UK Government hold a legally binding referendum as to whether the proposed refurbishment of the Palace of Westminster should take place, or whether instead, a new Parliamentary campus be established, allowing for disposal of the old site.
attributes.additional_details:
Give the people of the UK a say over where its parliament sits. 

The Palace of Westminster may occupy a historic site, but it is no longer fit for purpose. 

Build a modern, safe, secure, functional parliamentary campus with chambers, offices and accommodation on site. 

Turn the genuinely historic parts into a museum and sell off the rest of Westminster.

https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2017/mar/10/parliaments-buildings-risk-catastrophic-failure-without-urgent-repairs#comment-94650543
